Package core.modAPI

Interface CreatureEatBehavior

  • public interface CreatureEatBehavior
    Only one implementation of this interface can be loaded at once. Implementing this interface allows you to control how creatures eat from tiles and deposit food to tiles (by vomiting or by dying)
    Author:
    clay

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void creatureDepositFoodToTile​(Creature c, Tile t, double amount)
      Basically the reverse of creatureEatFromTile().
      void creatureEatFromTile​(Creature c, Tile t, double amount, double attemptedAmount, double timeStep)
      Called when a creature tries to eat food from a tile after calling getCreatureEatAmount().
      void creatureFailToEatFromTile​(Creature c, Tile t, double amount, double attemptedAmount, double timeStep)
      Called when a creature tries to eat food from a tile after calling getCreatureEatAmount().
      double getCreatureEatAmount​(Creature c, Tile t, double attemptedAmount, double timeStep)
      Called when a creature tries to eat food from a tile to determine how successful it is.

    • Method Detail

      • getCreatureEatAmount

        double getCreatureEatAmount​(Creature c,
                            Tile t,
                            double attemptedAmount,
                            double timeStep)
        Called when a creature tries to eat food from a tile to determine how successful it is. It shouldn't modify the creature or the tile.
        Parameters:
        c - the creature attempting to eat
        t - the tile it's attempting to eat from
        attemptedAmount - the amount of food that the creature is trying to eat
        timeStep - not sure what this is, but Evolvio Original and Evolvio Color needed it.
        Returns:
        the amount of food that the creature actually will eat

      • creatureEatFromTile

        void creatureEatFromTile​(Creature c,
                         Tile t,
                         double amount,
                         double attemptedAmount,
                         double timeStep)
        Called when a creature tries to eat food from a tile after calling getCreatureEatAmount(). This method should handle what happens when a creature actually eats from a tile. It probably should modify both the creature and the tile
        Parameters:
        c - the creature eating
        t - the tile being eaten from
        amount - the amount of food being eaten
        attemptedAmount - the amount of food attempted to be eaten
        timeStep - I don't know what this is, it was needed for some of the Evolvio Original files

      • creatureFailToEatFromTile

        void creatureFailToEatFromTile​(Creature c,
                               Tile t,
                               double amount,
                               double attemptedAmount,
                               double timeStep)
        Called when a creature tries to eat food from a tile after calling getCreatureEatAmount(). This method should handle what happens when a creature actually eats from a tile but ends up not being able to eat anything. It probably should modify just the creature and not the tile.
        this is basically creatureEatFromTile() where amount <= 0
        Parameters:
        c - the creature eating
        t - the tile being eaten from
        amount - the amount of food being eaten
        attemptedAmount - the amount of food attempted to be eaten
        timeStep - I don't know what this is, it was needed for some of the Evolvio Original files

      • creatureDepositFoodToTile

        void creatureDepositFoodToTile​(Creature c,
                               Tile t,
                               double amount)
        Basically the reverse of creatureEatFromTile(). Called when a creature dies or "vomits". It should modify both the creature and the tile.
        Parameters:
        c - the creature depositing food
        t - the tile being deposited to
        amount - the amount being deposited
